summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Verizon Wireless, seeking telephone records for the period 2002-2006 as part of a criminal investigation into violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes. It includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure and a declaration form for the custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and signed the cover letter requesting Verizon Wireless to refrain from disclosing the subpoena's existence to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoff E. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena commanding Verizon Wireless to appear and produce records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Verizon
events.description: Verizon Wireless is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury in the Southern District of New York to testify and produce records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Verizon Wireless
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Verizon Wireless for telephone records from 2002-2006 as part of a criminal investigation.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks telephone records from Verizon Wireless for the period January 1, 2002, through December 31, 2006, indicating the investigation is focused on activities during those years.

The investigation is for alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement for illegal sexual activity).

The U.S. Attorney's Office specifically requested Verizon Wireless to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document is part of the 2019 federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, targeting communication records that could establish evidence of trafficking and related crimes.
